page.title: 09ST. LAURENCE'S_CANON PYON
page.content: The church is mainly 13th. and 14th. Century.There are several carved misericords. One wall has memorial tablets to a local family who have retained the same name for the eldest son for over 200 years. There are three generations now living bearing that name.A group of villagers work hard keeping the churchyard tidy.There is a team of local{bellringers.}The {bells}were restored in 1981 at Loughborough Bell Foundry and a new Tenor Bell has been added.They were originally cast in 1728 by{Abraham {Rudhall}of Gloucester and bear the following{inscriptions:- TREBLE}_Peace and Good Neighbourhood.{2nd}Prosperity to the Church of England.{3rd}_Abr. Rudhall cast us all.{4th}_Walwyn Hereford and Thomas Hill:Ch.Wardens {TENOR}_I to the Church the Living Call, And to the Grave do Summon All.
